sentences.en: Authority must have expressed its displeasure in the meantime.
sentences.cn: 一定是在这个时候权威人士表示了不快.

sentences.en: He braved his parents'displeasure by marrying the girl.
sentences.cn: 他不顾父母亲的不悦,娶了那女孩.

sentences.en: He evinced his displeasure by scowling.
He has been very vocal in his displeasure over the results.
sentences.cn: 他直言不讳地表达了他对结果的不满。

sentences.en: He just made his displeasure felt.
sentences.cn: 他只让人家感到他不高兴罢了.

sentences.en: He looked with displeasure at the meal that was set before him.
sentences.cn: 他不高兴地望着摆在面前的饭菜.

sentences.en: He made his displeasure patently obvious.
His rash outburst incurred the displeasure of the judge.
sentences.cn: 他勃然大怒使法官不悦.

sentences.en: I expressed displeasure, with my legendary humility and restraint.
sentences.cn: 我作出了不悦的表情, 我的谦卑克制精神是众所周知的.

sentences.en: I haven't as much to risk if I incur your displeasure.
sentences.cn: 即使惹你不高兴,我也没多大风险可担.

sentences.en: I incurred his displeasure by refusing the invitation.
sentences.cn: 我因拒绝邀请而惹怒了他.

sentences.en: Paulina's spirited remonstrances only aggravated Leontes'displeasure.
sentences.cn: 宝丽娜勇敢的劝谏只不过叫里昂提斯更加生气了.

sentences.en: She braved her parents'displeasure by marrying him.
sentences.cn: 她不顾父母的不悦而和他结婚.

sentences.en: The population has already begun to show its displeasure at the slow pace of change.
sentences.cn: 人民已经开始对变化的缓慢速度表示不悦。

words.tran_cn: 讨厌的；令人发火的；令人不愉快的

trans.tran_cn: 不愉快，不满意，悲伤，发怒，生气
trans.tran_en: Someone's displeasure is a feeling of annoyance that they have about something that has happened
